item.text: This is the title of a [http://www.amazon.com/Make-Road-Walking-Conversations-Education/dp/0877227756  book] published in 1990, transcribing a series of conversations between radical educators Myles Horton and Paolo Friere in 1987. The transcribers of this section of the conversation explain in a footnote that the phrase Friere is quoting is from a poem about pilgrimage by the Spanish poet Antonio Machado.
item.title: we make the road by walking

item.text: This page extrapolates the initial conditions provided by our educational wiki [[Growth Model]] by one month.
item.title: Growth Model (continued)

item.text: Wikispaces has over 10 million registered teachers and students. [http://www.wikispaces.com/content/classroom/about html].
item.title: Education Sector Wiki Use

item.text: Warning: This article is based on a review of the book, rather than the book itself [http://www.timeshighereducation.co.uk/books/wikipedia-and-the-politics-of-openness-by-nathaniel-tkacz/2017640.article html]
item.title: Wikipedia and the Politics of Openness

item.text: A summary of education sector wiki use, including some use numbers, some research, and some persistent barriers to effective use in K-12 and higher education.
item.title: Education Sector Wiki Use

item.text: The idea of a studio as a workspace comes from studium in Latin. The English word study can mean both a place and a practice: a study, to study. Is federated wiki both a studio space, and the practice of studying?
item.title: Study has Two Meanings
